fields.description:
When I go to a user page: http://jira.gfinet.com/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=myName

and click on the Assigned link under User Summary/Open Issue Filters

I end up on a Filter Navigator page with no incidents.
http://jira.gfinet.com/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&assigneeSelect=issue_current_user&statusIds=2&resolutionIds=-1

If I then click the view button without changing any selections, I then see my incidents almost as if the filter was never run. But the main content area says - Issue Navigator No matching issues found

So either this text should change to Please click view or there is a bug and this filter is not executing. 

Thanks,

Scott Rowe

Say that I have a project Abc and I want to rename it as ABC: JIRA refuses telling me that the project already exists. This is because at that stage Abc and ABC are one and the same. The way around is to rename Abc to ABCD and then ABCD to ABC!!!!

fields.description:
I have seen a JIRA 2.6.1 installation which allows sorting by several columns. The header block in the "Printable" browser display displays:

"Sort by: Status ascending, then by Updated ascending, then by (third column)".

Whenever one clicks on a column head, the sort is performed by this column first, then by the column selected before etc.

However I am unable to reproduce this on other JIRA 2.6.1 Enterprise sites.  When clicking on the column header in the "Printable" view the table is redisplayed sorted by the new column, but it is not sorted by the previous column. Also the header block displays "Sort by: (column)" only, without the "then by: (second column)" part.

The user owning the JIRA site with the multi column sorting capability also reports that this feature does not always work.

So the two questions are:

1. how do I enable multi column sorting on my JIRA 2.6.1 site?
2. how do I make this working reliably?
fields.summary: multi column sorting does not work

fields.description:
Migration and move logic - whereby an issue with an invalid status is moved to a valid status in the target workflow - does not handle resolution.

As the issue is not moved through the workflow in a normal manner, the status can be set with a bogus resolution or missing a required resolution.

Need to handle the following cases:
1. Issue is resolved with a resolution set -> moving issue to status that is not resolved and has not resolution.

2. Issue is unresolved -> moving issue to status that requires a resolution.
fields.summary: "Migration" and "Move" logic does not handle resolution

fields.description:
It is very frustrating that a link's type cannot be changed -- instead I must create a new link of a different type for the same two issues, and then remove the old link.  

Our users seem incapable of linking issues with the correct link type. Frequently developers get the releations backwards.  Other times they chose the generic "is related to" when there is a much more specific type that is appropriate, e.g. "depends on".  It is especialy annoying when there are a dozen issues linked, all wrongly.
fields.summary: Change Link Type option

fields.description: We use an agile development methodology and continuous integration, which can produce new builds as often as once an hour. It would be very useful to be able to track bugs on a per-build basis, rather than just by version, which is nowhere near the level of granularity that we would like (often a couple of hundred builds per version release). However, since currently a new version must be created by hand, we can't afford to do this for each build number. A web service that we could call to create a new version for a project would allow us to add this version to Jira as part of our build script.  Then QA would know which issues it could expect to see finished based on the build number that we've given them, rather than them having to search through bugs to find out that information.
fields.summary: Request web service method to create new versions of a project

fields.description: It would be very useful to have a way to create and edit issues via the web service. That way, issues could be raised and managed automatically by other programs when appropriate rather than requiring user intervention. This would be useful both for developing web services clients and also for integrating it with other programs, such as CRM software.
fields.summary: Request web service method to create and manage issues

fields.description:
I need to create several custom fields and I need to apply them to 25 out of my 30 projects in JIRA.

I would prefer not to create each custom field 25 times, once for each project, and I can not apply it Globally because this field should not be seen by the other 5 projects.

Is there a way where I can apply custom fields to groups of projects instead of individual ones or all of them?
fields.summary: Add custom fields to group of projects

fields.description:
We have JIRA connected to a backend SQL Server database. We would like to use Crystal Reports to create some adhoc reports but need to know what the table names are and what data is in them. 

Do you have a data dictionary available that can aid us in this?
fields.summary: Data Dictionary

fields.description:
The JIRA interface uses the following terms interchangably:

1. Project Lead
2. Lead Developer
3. Lead

When you set up a project and enter a user name in the "Lead Developer" field, this user is displayed as the "Lead Developer" on some pages, as the "Lead" on other pages and as the "Project Lead" on some other pages in JIRA.

It would help if you standardized on one single name instead of using all 3 interchangably.

--Rajan
fields.summary: Standardize on the use of field labels

fields.description:
CVS Integration is not working, but is showing no errors in the logs, or in testing the CVS modules individually from the CVS Menu under Administration.  When I commit to an issue, I run:
$ cd test/
$ vi file.txt
<changes>
$ cvs commit -m 'Testing CVS Integration for issue (ISSUE #)'
<cvs commit information>
<generates e-mail and sends>

The version (viewcvs) commit information does not show up, nor does it parse the 'cvs log' command for the issue number, it appears, as nothing is showing up in the comments, or in the Version Control tab.  I am confused as to why this would happen, because I am receiving no errors, either out of CVS or Jira.  Also, when I look into the 'cvs log' command for my module, I can see the message I put in there, with the proper issue #, so it appears Jira is not parsing it.
fields.summary: CVS Not parsing updates, no error messages

fields.description:
We moved our server into the DMZ zone of the network and opened it up to the outside world, since then we are having problems getting all of the mail to send.

From JIRA we are able to send test messages that go through just fine. Users are receiving messages about password changes, and occasionaly users will receive ticket updates through email.

Under the mail queue link on the admin page, the mail queue tab will have, lets just say 20 mails in it. After about 15-30 minutes all the mail in the queue will slowly leave the queue, then it will all re-appear (highlighted in pink) along with new mails. This process will repeat indefineatly.

SMTP communications from the server have been tested from command line smtp commands to both internal and external clients. Test messages sent from JIRA to internal and external clients work. But when JIRA generates a message about ticket updates or changes to send to issue watchers, they do not get sent out, just keep getting repopulate in the mail queue highlighted in pink.

Any thoughts?
fields.summary: Mail is not leaving mail queue
Issue queries should be done via HTTP GET rather than HTTP POST

fields.description: When OSUser settings are customized to utilize an external user management database or authentication (such as LDAP), the "Forgotten Password" feature sends the password stored in the Jira database and not the one which is actually utilized during authentication. This is very confusing for most users. Please add a preference which enables the administratoris to remove the forgotten password feature from the web user interface.
fields.summary: Add preference to disable forgotten password functionality

fields.description:
Currently one of the predefined reports a user can add to their dashboard is: "Open Issues By Assignee"

It would be great to be able to have a predefined report / statistic for "Open Bugs By Assignee", - or rather "Open 'Issues-Type' By Assignee".
fields.summary: New Stat/Report: Open Issue-Type By Assignee

fields.description:
JIRA serves a different CSS stylesheet for "old" browsers that presumably don't fully support CSS1, like Netscape 4.  The actual check for old-browser-ness is:

If useragent is null or (not msie and not moz and not opera)

This means more modern browsers like Konqueror are probably being considered 'old' and fed the old stylesheet. Given the rather minimal browser share of NS4 these days, we can probably drop this check and just serve one CSS to all browsers.
fields.summary: JIRA assumes buggy CSS handling for uncommon browsers

fields.description: The fix for JRA-3274 exposed another problem, namely that a non-web action (DataImport) calls a web action (IndexAdminImpl), which then breaks when trying to call getRedirect().  See the FIXME comment in JiraWebActionSupport
fields.summary: Ensure non-web actions don't call web actions

fields.description:
I'm registered to a lot of JIRA issue tracking systems, e.g. Spring, Hibernate, OpenSymphony, Atlassian. Sometimes I'm interested in a special version of a project which isn't released yet. I do not want to check each special version every week. Hence an email announcement would be great if a version is released.

The email should contain the project (with link), the release (with link), a link to the release notes or it could contain the whole release notes. A customized email could be possible also.

Like the "watch it" operation link on issue details page, there should be a "(un)register annoucement" link by each release on the road map page.

A background process should check every 30 minutes if there is a new released version. The releasing action should be at least 30 minutes old, because somebody could released a version by mistake and immediately unreleased the version again. The worst case is that the email annoucements are mailed after 60 minutes.
fields.summary: Email annoucement by releasing a version

fields.description:
I am trying to use a backend SQL Server 2000 database. I have an export file from a Jira installation (v2.5.3) that is setup using SQL as its database server. When I do the import, there are several user lists that do not populate. I can also not select 'ANY' on the user browser page and have it show all users.

I have attached the log files.
fields.summary: Import into SQL Server 2000 Database fails

fields.description:
We'd like to use long descriptions (500-1000 characters) in filters.
However, when users open filters pop-up the description's text is not wrapped and shows up as a single line.

Is it configurable?  Id not it'd be a good small improvement.
fields.summary: Wrap 'Filter Description'

fields.description:
When filtering issues for any project, if a user specifies "Updated after' and 'Updated before' dates, the system throws the following exception:

Issue Navigator 
Errors: 
An error occurred searching: java.lang.reflect.UndeclaredThrowableException 
An error occurred searching: java.lang.reflect.UndeclaredThrowableException 
 
The Issue Navigator allows you to browse all the issues in the system. Filters allow you to limit the issues that you see. 

Using the panel on the left, you can create and edit new filters. 

ERRORS: 
An error occurred searching: java.lang.reflect.UndeclaredThrowableException 
An error occurred searching: java.lang.reflect.UndeclaredThrowableException  


This is preventing use from generating specific reports.

We recently imported the database that was used on a Jira Pro 2.5.3 server into a Jira Pro 2.6 installation. The 2.5.3 database was using SQL Server 2000 as its backend, the 2.6 installation is using the hsql database.
fields.summary: Exception thrown when filtering by specific dates

fields.description:
In our organisation, we need to store fields that are calculated using the content of other fields. For instance, we need to create a date field which value is 2 days after the creation date.
Depending on the issue type and the project, the calculation rule is not the same: for bugs, it's "creation date + 2 days", but for enhancement it's "creation date + 5 days". It's something that should be automatic, because we cannot easily know what is the rule.
We need also to calculate integer fields or String fields based on values of other fields of the current issue.

In fact, the more flexible implementation of this should be to deliver the capability to define a Java class to define the default value of a field.
In this Java class, we should be able to use an API to access to the value of every other fields of the issue that is being submitted.
We should be able to associate a calculation class to a field at the field layout scheme level.
fields.summary: Calculated fields

fields.description:
i created a simple user, named ttest, pwd the same. the user is assigned to a simple user group. 

It is then possible to login with a user name Ttest (password given correctly), but its not possible to view any project.
fields.summary: logon with capital letter possible, when user is existing only with small letter

fields.description:
A request from a user:

> We have the need where feature enhancements on a project first has to be approved by the 3 or 4 main users of the system.
> 
> So, someone requests a new feature. The 3 main users (owners) of the project each has to approve the request. This approval phase must happen in parallel. If any one off them rejects it, the request must never reach the programmers. We also need to be able to get reports on why the requests were rejected.
fields.summary: Workflow improvement: support parallel step progression

fields.summary: JIRA prints webwork exceptions after XML import

fields.description: "It should be possible, for instance, to update the issue security level and issue type (bug, improvement, etc) when doing a bulk change."
fields.summary: Bulk edit issue types

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-4144].
  {panel}

Investigate using other Lucene text analyzers. Lucene supports Russian and German out of the box.

However, there are a number of other text analyzers available in the Lucene Sandbox:

http://jakarta.apache.org/lucene/docs/lucene-sandbox/

such as French, Chinese and Brazilian.

fields.description:
We almost always want to share filters with more than 1 group:
blah-users, blah-developers and blah-administrators.

Currently we have to create an extra group blah-all just for the purposes of sharing a filter - and have to manually make sure that it contains all of the members of all the other groups..... PITA :-(
fields.summary: Share filters with *multiple* groups

fields.description:
Currently to add 100 uses to the same group (after they are created) I need to edit each user and modify the groups they are a member of. A nice enhancement would be to provide this same interface (editing a users associated groups) to the group browser where an administrator could bulk select which users should be associated with which groups.

The admin would click on a group in the group browser and see a list of all users not in that group and a separate list of all users in the group, and then get to move users between the lists just like editing a user's groups works now.
fields.summary: Enhance group browser with edit to bulk assign users to groups

fields.description: At some stage we should move from Tomcat 2.1.29 to 5.0.x.  Mainly because we can then specify the hsqldb url in non-relative terms, with 'jdbc:hsql:${catalina.home}/database/tomcatdb'. This will prevent the occasional user thinking they lost all their data when starting JIRA from a different directory.
fields.summary: Upgrade JIRA Standalone to Tomcat 5.x

fields.description:
SITUATION:
I have a list of issues in the issue navigator, created by a filter or a search.
As bulk editing is possible only for selected fields, I edit one issue after the other in the "classic" way, i.e. select the issue, edit and update it, finally use [Find Issues] to recreate the issue list.

PROPOSAL FOR NEW FEATURE:
Browse buttons |< < > >| above or under the issue editor allow me to navigate to the first, before, next or last issue in the result list. 

Optionally, the list is updated according to the filter settings, so evtl. the issue last edited is no longer in the result list.
fields.summary: Add First/Last <</>> links when navigating Search request Issues (View Issue page)

fields.description: As already mentioned before from Frank Schimmel: USE CASE: Use this signature for versioning: 1.1.1 Create an issue with "Fix for Version(s)" = 1.1.1. Export a search result containing this issue and with active column "Fix for Version" to Excel. EXPECTED: In Excel, all columns retain the original format. REAL: The "Fix for Version(s)" column in the Excel document shows "01.01.2001", and reformatting (e.g. to Standard format") results in 36892. NOTE: A version like 1.0.0 does fine when exported to Excel. NOTE additionally: The suggested workaround : Comment by Owen Fellows [08/Jul/04 01:23 PM] [ Permlink ] This is because excel automatically converts it. Can you try editing navigator-excel.jsp and changing <%-- Fix For Versions (potentially costly call) --%> <%@ include file="/includes/snippets/listbyname.jsp" %> to <%-- Fix For Versions (potentially costly call) --%> " <%@ include file="/includes/snippets/listbyname.jsp" %> " I'm not sure if this will work but work a try. ... is unfortunately not helping. Do you have any other idea? Thx Titus Leskien
fields.summary: Excel Export converts "For Version" Field to Date -

fields.description: Issue Types can only be deleted if there is a similar Issue Type - i.e. workflow and field layout scheme (as in Edit Issue now) - available to move the issue(s) to.
fields.summary: Ensure that Issue Types can not be deleted if there is no similar Issue Type

fields.description:
It would be usefull to have a kind of 'Developper Road Map' where assigned issues could be ordered (the order in which bugs will be corrected). This way a manager could order assigned bugs and users could check when (after how many bugs) his bug will be corrected. 

Right now you could almost simulate that using bug criticity, but you can't say which bug with the same criticity will be corrected first... and sometimes a less critical bug is schedule before a more critical bug...
fields.summary: Ability to have a "Developper Road map" which order bug resolutions

fields.description:
Currently if I am traversing a set of issues making various changes I have to do the following for each issue:

1 - click on issue in Issue Navigator
2 - click on the "Edit" operation
3 - make changes and click "Update"
4 - click "Next>>" 
5 - loop back to step 2

What I'd like to see is an "Update and edit next" button on the edit screen. The button would commit the changes to the current issue and take me directly in to the edit screen for the next issue in my search results. That would allow me to change the above process to:

1 - click on issue in Issue Navigator 
2 - click on the "Edit" operation 
3 - make changes and click "Update and edit next" 
4 - loop back to step 3 

That would save me a lot of time when dealing with a long list of issues
fields.summary: Add "Update and edit next" button to Edit screen

fields.description:
After importing a database created with JIRA 2.6.1 enterprise JIRA is partially broken. 

It is not possible to create new bugs, after clicking the "Next" button in step 1 nothing happens. There are logs of exceptions in catalina.out. 

It is also not possible to create custom fields. Since the existing projects use custom fields, I believe both symptoms are related.
fields.summary: custom fields broken after importing 2.6.1 database

fields.description: When I export data to excel format and open the file with OS X Office 2004, all the URLs in the export point to file://localhot/browse/(issue id here). Correct behavior would be to use the Jira base URL.
fields.summary: Excel export URL's point to file://localhost

fields.description: With the ability to create new statuses - the new status ids should not conflict with original system status ids. The new statuses should obtain ids from > 10000.
fields.summary: New Statuses should be assigned non-system ids - e.g > 10000

fields.description:
When trying to upload an attachment to a ticket, we consistently get the following error after submitting the form:

Invalid Form Data, no boundary encountered.
fields.summary: Error when attaching file to ticket

fields.description: we don't want that all of our users can update some of our custom fields.
fields.summary: defining per field access control in projects
adding custom fields in Resolve screen

fields.description: It would be very handy if an issue's vote count were available as a sortable field in the issue navigator.  One could then rank arbitrary searches of issues by vote, and add a "popular issues" search to the dashboard.
fields.summary: Sort by votes
Finish beta Jelly tags

fields.description:
Custom Fields are great, but they would be even better if they could be both Issue Type *AND* project specific.  This means if we want a field called 'Change Request Cost' for issue type 'Change Request' only with a particular project we can.

Right now, all we can do is 

1) add it to the project, but then other issue types have the field (a 'Change Request Cost' is confusing when raising a 'Defect')
2) Add it to the issue type, then use Issue Field Scheme to hide it from all the other projects that don't want to use it
fields.summary: Support custom fields that are both project and issue type specific

fields.description: The Admin section in JIRA 2.6 has organized the pages into collapsible sections.  When the menu link is clicked to open/close a section, JIRA redirects to the current page, with extra URL parameters.  If the current URL implies a server-side operation, this operation is performed again (except without correct parameters, so it usually fails).
fields.summary: Clicking admin menu links cause the last action to be performed again

fields.description: It would be interesting to be able to configure email notifications so that changes are from the person who made the change.  For example, if a developper resolves a bug, the bug resolution notification would come from him. This way, if I have any comment on that change, I would simply have to hit the reply button.
fields.summary: Mail Notification "From" field enhancement

fields.description:
I enabled gzip compression on my JIRA installation and now all of 
the HTML pages are showing up as jibberish. I am the JIRA administrator so I have access, but WHERE do I go to get back to the page to disable this?
fields.summary: How to turn off compression?

fields.description:
We should upload the latest license agreements to the website, and link to them from the download page and the source download page:

"The source available here is released under _these licenses_. If you
have any queries about the use of the source, please ask and we'll be
happy to help."


We could also (potentially), send them in email when someone purchases from our website.
fields.summary: Upload license agreements to website

fields.description:
Currently velocity generation fails if the war file is not unpacked. This is listed in issues JRA-3558, JRA-3671, JRA-3788, and also JSP-65.

This appears a problem across application servers (Tomcat, JBoss and Weblogic).

Owen had a suggestion, which doesn't seem to have been followed up on:

" I think the problem is that it is using a file system loader and not a classpath loader.
See.
  http://jakarta.apache.org/velocity/developer-guide.html#Configuring Resource Loaders

If we jar up the vm templates this should stop the errors in tomcat."

We should investigate this, and fix this problem.
fields.summary: Velocity template generation failed

fields.description:
Ensure that all appropriate permissions are available on initial setup.

With the introduction of new permissions - e.g. EDIT_WATCHER_LIST - ensure that these permissions are granted to correct users/groups when JIRA is setup initially.
fields.summary: Ensure appropriate permissions available on initial setup

fields.description:
First I would like to apologize if this is the wrong place for this, but I didn't want to start a flame war on the groups.

I disagree with the reasoning in this statement from your features page:

Associate multiple CVS modules with projects

Larger projects often have files distributed over multiple CVS modules. JIRA Enterprise extends JIRA Professional's CVS integration by allowing multiple modules to be associated with each project.



I work for a small non profit that has a CVS project for each hostname we publish (members,www) as well CVS projects containing our utils and our business(hibernate) objects/DAOS (util,bo).  We call each of these things a Jira component in one Jira project because our users have a lot of problems telling the difference where their problems are happening.  I don't consider this an enterprise feature.  It is just good design to section your API layers into their own CVS projects.  Users filing bugs should be forced to know about these seperations.
fields.summary: Disagreement with resoning behind cvs feature

fields.description:
The HTTP-headers of the Dashboard page and Browse pages differ, causing some proxy servers (e.g. Microsoft ISA server) to succesfully cache/update the Dashboard page, but to fail caching the browse-pages correctly (see JRA-4019 ).

Here are the liveheaders of the Dashboard page
(generated using Mozilla/Liveheaders):

http://internal:8080/secure/Dashboard.jspa

GET /secure/Dashboard.jspa HTTP/1.1
Host: internal:8080
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.7) Gecko/20040626 Firefox/0.9.1
Accept: text/xml,application/xml,application/xhtml+xml,text/html;q=0.9,text/plain;q=0.8,image/png,*/*;q=0.5
Accept-Language: en-us,en;q=0.5
Accept-Encoding: gzip,deflate
Accept-Charset: ISO-8859-1,utf-8;q=0.7,*;q=0.7
Keep-Alive: 300
Connection: keep-alive
Referer: http://internal:8080/secure/BrowseProject.jspa
Cookie: seraph.os.cookie=foo.bar; JSESSIONID=foo.bar

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store,  must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache, no-cache
Expires: Thu, 01 Jan 1970 00:00:00 GMT, -1
Content-Type: text/html;charset=UTF-8
Transfer-Encoding: chunked
Date: Mon, 26 Jul 2004 11:20:13 GMT
Server: Apache-Coyote/1.1

--------------------------------

Here are the headers for a Browse page

http://internal:8080/browse/ISSUE-1

GET /browse/ISSUE-1 HTTP/1.1
Host: internal:8080
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.7) Gecko/20040626 Firefox/0.9.1
Accept: text/xml,application/xml,application/xhtml+xml,text/html;q=0.9,text/plain;q=0.8,image/png,*/*;q=0.5
Accept-Language: en-us,en;q=0.5
Accept-Encoding: gzip,deflate
Accept-Charset: ISO-8859-1,utf-8;q=0.7,*;q=0.7
Keep-Alive: 300
Connection: keep-alive
Referer: http://internal:8080/secure/Dashboard.jspa
Cookie: seraph.os.cookie=foo.bar; JSESSIONID=foo.bar

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: text/html;charset=UTF-8
Transfer-Encoding: chunked
Date: Mon, 26 Jul 2004 11:20:49 GMT
Server: Apache-Coyote/1.1
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: -1

--------------------------------------

Suggested improvement:

a) make the caching HTTP-headers in all Jira pages work the same

b) add "Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store,  must-revalidate" and 
"Pragma: no-cache" to response headers in Browse pages (and possible others)

c) Why does the Dashboard page gives a response header of
"Pragma: no-cache, no-cache". I assume this is a bug, and it should be "Pragma: no-cache".

d) Use "Expires: Thu, 01 Jan 1970 00:00:00 GMT, -1" instead of 
"Expires: -1" header in Browse pages.

e) Follow the HTTP/1.1 standards http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html 
and make sure it works proxy servers such as Apache and Microsoft ISA server.
fields.summary: Change HTTP headers of browse page to prevent caching of pages

fields.description:
When creating issues in Jira using a tabbed browser (Mozilla and Firefox were explicitly tested) and creating multiple issues with the same contents, but applying to different projects, and the user submits an issue before another one of the similar issues has successfully completed submission, then the user gets the following error:

# Form Errors:
An exception occurred: java.lang.NullPointerException.

This issue can probably be replicated on non-tabbed browsers.
fields.summary: java.lang.NullPointerException error when submitting issues too close together

fields.description: The Bugzilla and Mantis importers have a checkbox, "Send email notifications".  If checked, JIRA is meant to send a notification email for every operation performed during import.  Currently it doesn't work, because a) the parameter defaults to 'off' and the actual selection isn't propagated through the JSPs correctly, b) there is no default notification scheme associated with new projects.
fields.summary: Bugzilla / Mantis importer: option to send notification emails broken

fields.description: Certain actions on JIRA issues (comments, edits etc) can have a visibility level associated with them, to only let members of a certain group see the update.  The notification email generated should give some indication that the content has been restricted.
fields.summary: Notification emails should include visibility

fields.description:
In order to aid our QA process, I just added a "Quality Assurance Review Status" custom field to all Quality Assurance issues. The idea would be that engineers could then search for issues of type Quality Assurance with a QA Review Status of "Requires Review."

Then I found out that the search/filter panel does not allow us to filter our searches on custom fields. IMHO, this makes custom fields next to useless.
fields.summary: Cannot search on context specific (project or issue type) custom fields on the first screen

fields.description: There is no way for users to replace file attachments. While they can add new file attachments, this leads to a long list of evolving documents. We don't want this -- we only want the one, current version of a document attached to a issue. The only workaround is to have the administrator delete the unwanted documents. Right now, the administrator here is being tasked with deleting dozens of documents a day... Ideally, only the person that originally uploaded a document would be able to delete it.
fields.summary: Users cannot delete/replace file attachments

fields.description:
Add new permissions for "view/edit watchers" and "view voters".

This should be incorporated in the new permission scheme.
fields.summary: Create Permissions for "View/Edit Watchers" and "View Voters"

fields.description:
If I assign 'Current Reporter' to any permission scheme instance for any project, every other login can see that the project exists.  The other 'unauthorised' views do not show issues, just that the project exists.

I am trying to have one project setup to have many clients access it - current reporter set against 'Browse Projects' works well i.e. the clients logging into this project can only see the issues attributable to them.  The problem is that users belonging to groups within entirely different project can see that this first project exists ... don't want that to happen ... different product set.
fields.summary: Current Reporter view

fields.description: Add a new "Filter Statistics" portlet that provides statistics based on the results of a specified filter.
fields.summary: Add new statistics portlet that provides stats based on a specified filter.

fields.description:
Release notes are incomplete if a summary contains HTMl special characters.

Should encode the various parts of the release note templates that may contain HTML special characters.
fields.summary: Release notes are incomplete if a summary contains HTML special characters.

fields.description: I am looking for a system whereby new users get X votes and they can only get new votes from the administators (either manually or automatically) using some script that increments their vote-count by interfacing with JIRA.
fields.summary: Allow multiple votes per user

fields.description:
We run Oracle's standby server called Dataguard, which does real-time replication of live production data to a remote site.  Our current setup does a physical standby, but we want to set up a local logical standby, meaning the DB instance is actually mounted for us to hit with queries w/out affecting the primary production instance.

The problem is that Oracle for some reason will not allow a logical standby instance of live data if the datatype LONG is used... it only likes numbers.  So you ask why do they do this?  I don't know... it's Oracle, they are strange.  Anyway, what's the chance you can change the following column's data type to NUMBER instead of LONG?  Is it technically feasible?

Table: PROPERTYDATA
Column: PROPERTYVALUE
Current Datatype: LONG RAW

Oooohhh even more fun... I think it has to do with the customfield stuff???
fields.summary: Change field type from LONG RAW to BLOB for Oracle

fields.description:
We are seeing the following behaviour:

We do a search (filter) for a given project, for a comment containing, say, "Pol Pot".

Lets say this search returns 4 issues (that happen to be assigned to the same user: maotsetung)

If we now do the same search, but this time specify assignee: "maotsetung", the filter returns zero results.

Try with j.a.com and search for "arse" in comments. Then also search for "arse" and assigned to mike@atlassian.com.
fields.summary: Search in comments fails if asignee also specified

fields.description:
On the User browser page, the Any filter to display all users is not working. The page reads:

Displaying users 0 to of . (Reset Filter) 


If you select a group from the drop down list and hit filter, the users for that group are displayed, but if you select ANY from the list, no users are displayed.

This happened after connecting JIRA to a SQL backend database. 

I have deleted and recreated the database and used differnt backup xml files, but the result is the same.

Is this a know issue, and if so is there a fix for it.
fields.summary: User browser page is not displaying users
